project.description: A project to hold integrations with EC2 clouds

property.description: Path where the supporting scripts and jars used for evaluating DSL scripts for validation and dynamic options are located. A relative path is considered relative to the plugin's install directory.
Set to '1' if the server-side validations and dynamic options retrieval need to be disabled in Dynamic Environments for this plugin.

procedure.description: Hook for CloudManager to remove servers

formalParameter.description: A list of deployments to stop
The name of an EC2 config created from the EC-EC2 plugin configuration page.

procedure.description: Hook for CloudManager to sync servers

formalParameter.description: A list of deployments to stop
The name of an EC2 config created from the EC-EC2 plugin configuration page.

procedure.description: Hook for CloudManager to add servers

formalParameter.description: The name of an EC2 config created from the EC-EC2 plugin configuration page.
The OS device that the optional snapshot should be connected to.
The AMI or EMI image to use
The EC2 instance type to create
The EC2 security group for the new instances
An optional EC2 snapshot. If specified, a new volume will be created from the snapshot and attach to the running instance
User Data to pass to the new instance
The EC2 zone to use
Number of new servers
Pool name for resources

procedure.description: Allocate an Elastic IP

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Where to put the result. If not specified, the result is only printed

procedure.description: Describe one or more instances

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Where to put the result. If not specified, the result is only printed
Instances. A single instance, semi-colon separated list of instances, or a reservation.

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The instance to be associated with an IP
The Elastic IP to associate to an instance

procedure.description: Attach a list of volumes to a list of instances

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use

procedure.description: Make a copy of an EBS instance

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The description for the new image
The instance to duplicate
The new name for the created image

By default this parameter is set to false, which means Amazon EC2 attempts to cleanly shut down the instance before image creation and reboots the instance afterwards. When the parameter is set to true, Amazon EC2 does not shut down the instance before creating the image. When this option is used, file system integrity on the created image cannot be guaranteed
Where to put the results

procedure.description: Creates a key pair using Amazon EC2.

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Property to store result

procedure.description: Create a new Virtual Private Network.

formalParameter.description: The name of the config which holds all the connection information. This must reference a valid existing configuration.
Name to be given to VPC.
The range of IPs to use for your VPC, in CIDR format, for example,10.0.0.0/24.Block size must be between a /16 netmask and /28 netmask.
Where to put the result. If not specified, the result is only printed.

procedure.description: Create a new subnet

formalParameter.description: The name of the config which holds all the connection information. This must reference a valid existing configuration.
Name to be given to subnet
The range of IPs to use in subnet, in CIDR format, for example,10.0.0.0/24.The range of IP addresses in subnet must be subset of IP address in VPC.Size subnet can equal the size of VPC.
Availability zone where this subnet will reside.If no preferences is entered, Amazon will choose an availability zone for you.
VPC to use for this subnet.
Where to put the result. If not specified, the result is only printed.

procedure.description: Delete existing Virtual Private Cloud

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
ID of VPC to delete
Property to store result

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
If set, the volume is not deleted after being detached from the instance.
Name of volume to delete on termination

procedure.description: Release an Elastic IP address

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Elastic IP Address

procedure.description: Run the API. Individual API procedures collect parameters and call this procedure. Credentials should be attached here.

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The method to run

step.description: Run an EC2 api call using the Amazon Perl API

procedure.description: Run instances

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The number of instances to start
The security group to use
The name of the EC2 image that you would like to deploy
Instance Type
The ID of the subnet to launch the instance(s) into (for use with VPCs)

The primary IP address. You must specify a value from the IP address range of the subnet.If no value is supplied then IP address from the IP address range of the subnet is selected.(for use with VPCs)
Specify the instance behaviour when an OS-level shutdown is performed.Instance can be either terminated or shut down.
Property path to store results
Extra user data to pass into runInstance
The Availability Zone you want to launch the instance into.
Optional pool name. If not blank, a new resource will be created and placed in the pool
Optional. Assigned to the resources created.
Optional. Assigned to the resources created.
Use private IP
Created resource will belong to the specified zone. Zone 'default' is used by default.
Created resource will belong to the specified zone. Zone 'default' is used by default.
If specified, new instance will be associated with given IAM profile.

procedure.description: Start instance

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The name of the EC2 instance that you would like to deploy

procedure.description: Stop instance

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The id of the EC2 instance that you would like to stop

procedure.description: Terminate an instances

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
If this is an instance id, terminate that one instance. If this is a reservation id, terminate all instances in the reservation
List of resources to be deleted.

procedure.description: Terminate an instances

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Resource name for termination

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use

procedure.description: Delete a configuration

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use

procedure.description:
Cleanup an auto deployed EC2 instance.
The keypair, storage, elastic IP, and security settings will all be deleted.

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The reservation id to clean up. All instances in the reservation will be cleaned up.
Name of volumes to delete on termination. Separate list of volume id's with semi-colons.
List of resources to be deleted.

procedure.description:
A procedure to deploy an EC2 instance.
The keypair, storage, elastic IP, and security settings will all be automatically created and associated

formalParameter.description: A key used to match a cleanup step to the right provision step. This allows recursive and/or multiple calls within a procedure
The configuration to use
How many Instances to AutoDeploy
The name of the EC2 instance that you would like to deploy
The security group to use
Instance Type
The property sheet where results should be saved
snapshot id to be snapped into a volume and attached to the new instances If no snapshot id is given, no volumes will be attached
Extra user data
volume device for attachment OS dependent: Example: /dev/sdf in Linux and UNIX or xvdf in Windows
Where the instance should be created
Optional pool name. If not blank, a new resource will be created and placed in the pool
Optional. Assigned to the resources created.
Optional. Assigned to the resources created.

procedure.description: Pause a deployed instance-store backed instance This disconnects volumes and saves them, it then terminates the instance. Auto Resume will start a new instance and re-attach the volumes

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
List of instances to terminate. Can be a reservation, a single instance, or list of instances
List of volumes to detach from instances.

procedure.description: Resume a paused instance-store backed instance A new instance is started and the saved volumes are re-attached

formalParameter.description: A key used to match a cleanup step to the right provision step. This allows recursive and/or multiple calls within a procedure
The configuration to use
The name of the EC2 instance that you would like to deploy
The security group to use
Instance Type
volume device for attachment OS dependent: Example: /dev/sdf in Linux and UNIX or xvdf in Windows
List of volumes to attach to the new instances.

procedure.description: create a new snapshot from volume attached to instance Note, only snaps first volume found

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
Instance ID of a running EC2 instance
Where to put results
the volume ID to be snapped

procedure.description: Deploy instances with volumes attached and clean up afterwards

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use

procedure.description: Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified Amazon EC2 resource or resources

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The IDs of one or more resources to tag
The comma separated list of key-value (key => value, key2 => value2)

procedure.description: Set instance name.

formalParameter.description: The configuration to use
The ID of instance
The new name of instance

procedure.description: Updates instances attributes.

formalParameter.description: The name of the config which holds all the connection information. This must reference a valid existing configuration.
Instance ID to update.
The security group to use.
The instance type.
Extra user data to pass to runInstance.
Specify the instance behaviour when an OS-level shutdown is performed. Instance can be either terminated or shut down.

procedure.description: Delivers binary dependencies from the CloudBees CD server to the agent.
